review: It's a pretty solid streaming stick with a couple of drawbacks. It supports basically every streaming service and a few hundred you've never heard of, it's fast, easy to use, easy to set up, and simple to operate. Where it loses me is the remote - the remote loses connections randomly, has significant lag when in use, and doesn't have any kind of IR support, which means no universal remote for you. The boot times are long - easily two minutes sometimes and you learn very quickly you dont want to power this thing from the USB. You're going to want to plug this in to the wall and just keep it on or else you'll  get frustrated waiting for the stick to boot so you can watch Netlfix. That said, the device is still excellent and worth buying.I've owned a chromecast as well, and one key advantage with the stick is that it also supports casting functions though this one is a bit more. If you want a simpler interface and are willing to pay a bit more for it, this is great for you. Otherwise, stick with chromecast.It's a solid streaming stick, but it has some drawbacks. Overall, it's a win.
author: James Smithe

review: I was looking for a device to reduce my Cable cost and found it!Took only a few minutes to be up and running. I was using my Blue ray player to stream Amazon Prime movies. It was difficult to organize and make movie selections. With my Roku the format is so much better and  the convenience of having more programs to watch is fantastic. I recommend it, if you are looking for a fine streaming device. After purchasing one Roku, and using it for a few days, I was so pleased that I ordered two more. another for my Wife to  use and I sent the other to my Daughter. She also had no problem installing the Roku. Her seven year old Daughter after a few minutes, was able to master the basic, simple to use Remote, and found many movies and programs such as Sponge Bob Square Pants to watch. My Daughter and Granddaughter both love their Roku..
author: Pj Waldo
